content.title: Welcome in learning path section.
content.paragraph: Here you can find what and when I learned, a little bit of description and links to resources which I used.

table.td2: I have created my personal website in version 2.0, where You are now :-)

Java Script, JQuery

I remind myself basics of Java Script language and JQuery with The Net Ninja YT channel. It brought back to my mind a couple of those details what will help me write my code more efficiently and smartly.

Java Script fr beginners by The Net Ninja on YouTube

JQuery for beginners by The Net Ninja on YouTube

I started using GItHub and Git

I created my GitHub account and started learn how to use it within my projects.
You can find me on https://github.com/piotrzalecki

I took my GitHub and Git lessons on:

  • The Net Ninja Git and GitHub tutorial
  • Partially on other resources found on google.com

I created my personal website in version 1.0.

First version of my website

Bootstrap 3 on The Net Ninja YouTube channel

I learned how to create responsive website using Bootstrap framework. Mainly how work gird system and how to style website with Bootstrap and how to use another features.

Bootstrap 3 by The Net Ninja on YouTube

Node JS Tutorial for Beginners on The Net Ninja YouTube channel

I studied how to create server and communicate with it using Node JS technology. I done this course to get a little bit of knowledge about how to use serer side languages. I was most interested in how to read and write data in databases, but I learned much much more.

Node JS by The Net Ninja on YouTube

Cloud Computing and AWS Servers on linuxacademy.com

I studied basics concepts of cloud computing and Amazon Web Servers. I learned how AWS works and how to run and setup basic servers.

AWS Concepts on linuxcademy.com
AWS Essentials on linuxcademy.com

Linux Essentials, Linux+ LPIC Level 1 Exam 1 and 2 on linuxacademy.com

I studied Linux operations system. I learned basic and more advanced system administration skills. Course include very wide range of topics not only about OS but about Internet technologies as well. Full course descriptions and topics you can find in links below.

Linux Essentials on linuxcademy.com
Linux+ LPIC Level 1 Exam 1 course on linuxcademy.com
Linux+ LPIC Level 1 Exam 2 on linuxcademy.com

Diploma in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript on Alison.com

On this course I learned HTML5, CSS3 and a basics of Java Script and JQuery. It gave me descent knowledge about how to create good websites from scratch, how properly tag content, how to style it in cascade sheets and bring it to live with Java Script. It shown me a little bit of good practices within building web pages.

Diploma in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript on Alison.com

My learning path started long time ago...

I had my first PC when I was 14 years old. From the beginning I was using it not only for play games but for create and research IT technologies as well. Because of that I can say that I have experience in:

  • basic administrations tasks in Windows OS,
  • using CMS Joomla in creating websites,
  • using GIMP and Fotoshop to edit graphic,
  • using Inkscape to create graphic,
  • using software to edit video and music files,
  • basic network configuring,
  • Turbo Pascal and Borland Delphi.
